docs.lead_paragraph: It is the custom in some New-England Colleges, for the person matriculating as a student to have placed before him for his signature a copy of the laws of the institution. Of course he puts down his name, more careful whether his chirography is creditable than as to the contents of the document he thus pledges himself to be guided by.

docs.lead_paragraph: TOO MUCH GAS.--The following nisi prius case lately tried in England, will not be uninteresting to the deaizens of our City who live in the neighborhood of Gas Works, and who, if they sleep with their windows open, sometimes seriously demur to the propriety of the poet's expression of "balmy sleep."

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; NEW-YORK HISTORICAL SOCIETY. Proceedings of the Last Meeting--Original Portrait of Washington. THE TRADES. Journeymen Piano-Forte Makers. Meeting of Ship-Joiners. Board of Ten Governors. THE CANADA FORGERY CASE. Walker and Canal Streets. SUPREME COURT COURT OF OVER AND TERMINER. SUPERIOR COURT--SPECIAL TERM. TRIAL TERM TRIAL TERM. SUPREME COURT COURT OF COMMON PLEAS. COURT OF GENERAL SESSIONS. UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT. UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT.

docs.lead_paragraph: Proceedings of the Last Meeting--Original Portrait of Washington. The regular monthly meeting of the Society held in University Chapel on Tuesday evening, was well attended. DON JOSE FRANCISCO RAMIREZ, of Mexico, and Hon. DAVID L. SWAIN, President of University, North Carolina, were elected corresponding members, and several gentlemen as resident members.

headline.main: FRANCE.; PROGRESS OF POLITICAL EVENTS. Personal, Literary, Theatrical and Miscellaneous Gossip.

docs.lead_paragraph: Another hope has melted into thin air. The hope in HOHENZOLLERN, (or Hohenliden, spell the name,) has vanished like all its predecessors the hope in SAXE-COBOURG, the hope in ORLOFF, the hope in the autograph letter, the hope in numberless ultimatums.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Broadway Tabernacle Discussion. The Recent Murder in Philadelphia-Capture of the Culprit. The National Poultry Show. German Meeting to Appland the Veto. Board of Education. Street Nuisance. A DEATH BY YELLOW FEVER. THE NEW-YORK SKETCH CLUB. SALE OF VALUABLE BOOKS. THE CRANSTON BANK COUNTERFEITS. EXPLOSION--ACCIDENT. SIXTH REGIMENT.

docs.lead_paragraph: SECOND EVENING. The audience at the Tabernacle, last evening, was fully as large as at the opening of the Discussion. The disputants and their hearers were both very punctuation their attendance. Prayer was offered by Rev. Mr./NYE, of Brooklyn.

headline.main: COMMON COUNCIL PROCEEDINGS.; Board of Aldermen.

docs.lead_paragraph: NATHAN C. ELY, Esq., in the chair. On motion of lderman WOODWARD, the regular order of business was suspended, to allow of taking up papers from the Board of Councilmen. REPORTS CONCURRED IN. Of Finance Committee, in favor of an ordinance to appropriate $145,619, omitted to be raised for State School Tax in 1853.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. steamship Baltic, from Liver pool Wednesday, 22d ult., arrived at this port yesterday afternoon at 41/2 P. MI. The Baltic arrived out on the morning of Sunday, 19th, having been three days delayed??y ice, which damaged her cut water and floats. It was by the greatest exertions that the Baltic was ready to leave Liverpool on herappointed day.
